content:
Posted: February 2, 2015
												Welcome to over the top anime wacky nonsense. The game is a massive parody with wacky jokes, parody-pervy stuff and refrences to other things. I don't really like the whole young girl to woman pervy stuff but I'd like to think they did it again as a parody and knew full well what they were doing. The gameplay is fun and has a fairly deep battle mechanic from building combos, weapon arc differences, transformations, and seperate equipment slots for both character and transformed character...along with some crafting it sounds deep but it's honestly eased in a way that you can get your mind around it. There's been some mention of technical issues, I haven't seen any of this honestly, I'll leave my specs below so you can go off that. A fix I heard is you run the game in compatibility mode and that sorts the problem if you are having them. Check the community hub where they discuss it. While I know they made an improvement in framerate from 30~ on the Vita to 60 on PC, the lack of 1080+ resolution is confusing. Maybe it breaks something that they haven't sorted out yet? But it's not a huge deal. It looks fine so far, I hope they add more options but it's not subtractingIntel i7 4770k8gb ramgtx 970Windows8.1Visually the game is all over the place, character models look great, the maps look PS2 era in both texture and model quality, early PS2 mind you. Cutscenes have animated avatars via emofuri which adds some nice flow/movement ...boob jiggle to cutscenes. They look great and it's odd how much depth it adds to what's going on. They're not fully animated, so don't expect characters to twirl and slash weapons in dialoge cutscenes but it's a nice feature. Everything is a wink and a joke, enemy characters can just be silly or be cat-PS4's called Purr4. So if you're looking for a complex story that isn't 4th wall breaking self parody that mostly revolves around friendship and cute girls or girls with giant♥♥♥♥♥♥ This isn't the game for you. But if you're okay with that or just feel like trying something new? ...Or got the game for a friend whom declined it like myself...It's worth a shot, good comedy rpg honestly...just turn the game to japanese, then lower the voice volume, Neptune can be quite ...lively.Edit*******They've since updated the game fixing numerous bugs and letting the game run at 1080p. Yay for the people porting this game making it even better. That said I'd love it if they'd fix some of the text that runs out of the text boxes. |:DLC note: The DLC that you buy you can turn off in game, as you can get characters from it that aren't acknowledged but help you greatly in game. How much do they help? Well if you choose to use them, you'll find in some story battles they don't let you transform- this rule does not effect the DLC characters and you can bypass this, helping the battle be easier. That said you can also choose to not change them as well.

content:
Posted: April 15, 2016
												A lot has been written on this game already but here are my two cents : - Yes this game is grind-heavy but i really didnt mind at all. That's thanks to the remake system which provided tons of milestones : i never grinded only for XP i made plan after plan and i leveled up along the way. Also you can skip all animations which makes the whole thing much faster and less tedious.- There are a few absurb spikes in difficulty at the beginning of the game. It gets better though so dont give up.- As far as RPGs goes this is more of the sitcom kind. Dont expect a deep story it's about characters you like (hopefully) having fun and being silly. With a ton of references to games.- You can play with a keyboard just fine but you'll have to remap pretty much every single key. Also the game will still display the originals buttons so you'll have to remember what is what. Took me some getting used to and a few trips to the config section.- There is a moderate amount of fan service (panties, cleavage, jiggling boobs). You can "upgrade" to softcore hentai with mods if you're into it.- The music is okay. Nothing i wanted to listen outside the game but nothing that made me want to turn the sound off either.- This game recycle dungeons environnements and monsters models. A lot. - The achievements are all fairly easy but will take some time. The "millionaire" one is particularly grind heavy, even more so if you dont have the DLCs (to raise the level limit and get access to more powerful ennemies).

Lolita is a novel by Vladimir Nabokov, written in English and published in 1955 in Paris, in 1958 in New York, and in 1959 in London. It was later translated by its Russian-native author into Russian. The novel is notable for its controversial subject: the protagonist and unreliable narrator, a 37-to-38-year-old literature professor called Humbert Humbert, is obsessed with the 12-year-old Dolores Haze, with whom he becomes sexually involved after he becomes her stepfather. "Lolita" is his private nickname for Dolores.

content:
Posted: February 1, 2015
												I absolutely love this game, However I've had multiple issues with crashes and losing my game saves. I figured out that when you recieve the DLC characters it can cause a save corruption. the way around this is to get one of the characters from the event after the first boss, and then save. repeat the same steps with the second character. If you get them both at the same time for some reason it causes the game to crash the next time you try to save. dont lose 3 hours of game time like i did.also when i updated my pc I lost all of my 6 hours of progress. So effectively I have to start over. I have not found a fix for this yet unfortunately. But I will try to figure it out soon. Overall this game is great, and you should definitely give it a try. just be careful to backup your game saves.

content:
Posted: January 30, 2015
												Excellent port of quite possibly the best JRPG series going for an amazing comical adventure. Graphical improvements for Battle and Dungeon mode. Hell to the yes. 60 FPS Nep Nep yo. SIXTY. FPS. NEPPU. NEPPU. CAN YOU FEEL IT? CAN YOU FEEL THE AWESOME?! Neptune can, albeit maybe too much. Also Noire is my waifu.OH, and the fact you now get to enjoy the awesome soundtrack of Neptunia on a system that probably has (I say probably, as I power my system with a USB DAC and a mixer) a much more powerful audio amplification system is just Neppu-tastic. I could sit on the menu screen forever if I wanted... even.. though.. I have the OST... yeah..The only downsides of this port are hardly a downside at all.1: keyboard and mouse controls - Just don't do it. get a PS3 Controller or whatever gamepad and use it. There's no reason not to. If you subject yourself to torture via Cursor Confinement-less game window and the awkward controller map scheme for the Keyboard, then  you're on your own.2: Upscaled Visual Novel models and Aliased Cutscenes - These're hardly worth mention because;a) The cutscenes don't last long and the models aren't sitting around long enough for you to focus on the aliasingb) The upscaled visual novel models' quality degredation is hardly noticable as it's just a little bit of blurr. Unless you have extreme autism, you're going to be fine.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 3, 2015
												This is the game for you if you enjoy:- Anime- video games- clever references to anime and video games- characters breaking the 4th wall constantly- a story that's mostly about interaction between the characters in a comedic way- turn based JRPGs- small amounts of grinding here and there- huge amounts grinding to get absolutely everything (but you don't have to if you just want to finish the game)- games developed around the idea of "fun" instead of "making money"There's some fan service here and there, but overall it never felt that much out of place. If you've seen a couple anime, with their one-off hot spring episodes and so on, you know what to expect.Picked this up during the Summer Sale and have gotten 90+ hours out of it, friend of mine finished it with all achievements in 60 hours. So it really is as long and grindy as you want it to be (gotta get all the costumes).There's also some extra DLC that's free, but you have to install it kinda manually. Mostly some potions etc. to make early game a bit easier. Nothing really game-breaking. But I do applaud the decision to make it optional for players who don't want any help (muh core experiunce uhhh).All in all: Great game, definitely get it, if it goes on sale again, you wont regret it!

content:
Posted: April 15, 2016
												A lot has been written on this game already but here are my two cents : - Yes this game is grind-heavy but i really didnt mind at all. That's thanks to the remake system which provided tons of milestones : i never grinded only for XP i made plan after plan and i leveled up along the way. Also you can skip all animations which makes the whole thing much faster and less tedious.- There are a few absurb spikes in difficulty at the beginning of the game. It gets better though so dont give up.- As far as RPGs goes this is more of the sitcom kind. Dont expect a deep story it's about characters you like (hopefully) having fun and being silly. With a ton of references to games.- You can play with a keyboard just fine but you'll have to remap pretty much every single key. Also the game will still display the originals buttons so you'll have to remember what is what. Took me some getting used to and a few trips to the config section.- There is a moderate amount of fan service (panties, cleavage, jiggling boobs). You can "upgrade" to softcore hentai with mods if you're into it.- The music is okay. Nothing i wanted to listen outside the game but nothing that made me want to turn the sound off either.- This game recycle dungeons environnements and monsters models. A lot. - The achievements are all fairly easy but will take some time. The "millionaire" one is particularly grind heavy, even more so if you dont have the DLCs (to raise the level limit and get access to more powerful ennemies).

content:
Posted: July 11, 2015
												Full of humor and satire, this game made me laugh time and time again. The animebullsh*t here is just the right way over the top and all kinds of reperences to either games, gaming culture or japanese weirdness are droppes frequently.  Do not judge this game by its cover. The writing is excellent and the English translation is well localised. (I played with Japanese audio and English text so I was able to compare.)True to its theme the game includes a myriad of clothing choices for the heroines - some fairly fanservise-y type :P However, even the most perverted clothing doesn't really have any better stats than the others, so the player is free to choose what clothing pleases their eye the most. I myself felt a bit disturbed by some of the swimwear stuff tbh x'DIf you are like me an obsess about getting all the achievements and unlocking all the stuff, the game will turn a bit grindy after a second playthrough (new game plus). It took me around 100h to unlock everything, but only 30h or so to complete the storyline once. (And I am a slow player who even grinds before advancing the story after any boss^^)

content:
Posted: April 11, 2016
												Im not going to write jokes reviews about this game like some players did here so lets get startedHyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth 1 is a turn based rpg made by Idea Factory , Compile Hearts and Felistella . With a creative fighting style , this game has many features many RPGs dont have . For example , this game has a thing called " plan " which could change the game like adding stronger enemies in every dungeons or adding new items while some RPGs dont this game also have a heavy references to some animes/games and others , adding a funny to read visual novels , it makes the game betterhowever , every thing in the world , no matter how good it is have it bad sides right ? well in this game , there are some , for example , some new enemies in this game are not really " new enemies " , they're just different colour or different name . This game also force us to grind/farm alot because some in this game can just over powered us if we're underleveled , but grinding in this game is fun and not really boring for some reason , we all understand Compile Heart/Idea Factory is still new to gaming industry , the graphics in the game are just low textured and they use the same graphic in every game , but its an anime kind of game like Final Fantasy , so high graphic is not necessarynot suprising how the game/anime series makes a hit steam , as the jokes are funny , the references are easy to understand and the idea of the game is just brilliant , the game's story is long too , making the player able to enjoy the story moreThe price for the game is a little expensive but you can get it cheap when the game's on sale Overall , I recommend 8/10 for this game , I recommend you to buy it and support Idea Factory , Compile Hearts and Felistella

number of helpful: No ratings yet2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 2, 2016
												(One of the) Best gaming series ever made. R8 8/8 m8 time to masturb81+7 :)A friend gifted the latest title to me as a bit of a joke...*Plays game super attentively****3 hours later***Bought the rest of the games thanks to the massive black friday sales. I couldn't believe I hadn't discovered the gaming series before! I'm now addicted. Inner weeb levels are approaching over 9000!!!!=== No Spoiler Review ===But for real. Its like 1/3rd visual novel (with high quality voice acting) 1/3rd kawaii final fantasy (and nothing like FF10 part 2, that was trash) and 1/3rd fan service (depending on your.. preferences of course). I've been pleasantly surprised that the game itself is actually a challenge. You may have to grind at some points in order to beat bosses or change up your game style a bit to progress through back-to-back boss battles. Unlike most JRPGS, the grinding is actually fun and addicting in and of itself. The story and characters are all cute, funny, and well-developed (in more than 1 area... hehehe). Also, the music never gets old! Battle themes, dialogue music, the intro song... they're all very polished sounding. Legit production quality.Honestly the only let-down I've experienced so far is a recycling of monsters and level designs. It does take away from the immersion a bit when you find there are variations of essentially the same dungeon only pathed slightly differently and with recolored monsters. There really is a lot of recycling in those regards. I'm pretty forgiving about it, but it does annoy me. To make up for it, there are a crapton of character customizability options (cosplaying outfits, weapon plan creating, changing your combos, etc) that is really nice to see in a JRPG. I really enjoy the battle mechanics because, as the game difficulty gets harder throughout the game, you really have to plan your attacks to make them count. Its also nice that the battle system isn't a linear ATB, rather akin to games like the Star Oceans and Tales series you can move around freely within a battle scene to position yourself strategically. It is a turn-based battle system, but unlike the goofy stagger system Final Fantasy 13 TRIED to utillize but failed miserably at, HDN has a guard-break mechanic that doesn't require an hour of playing just to proc once like the game-which-must-not-be-named-but-i-already-named failure title used.Overall, its a really cute game with just as much substance as cuteness to supplement. I got the game on sale for $7 but even at its normal price of $30 I would buy it in an instant now that I've been introduced to the HDN brand and am in love with it.Pros:= Story= Characters= Music= Excellent Voice Acting (option for Japanese or English)= Battle System= Character Customizability= Challenging= Easily 40+ hour 1st time playthrough= Whether $7 or $30 it is worth every pennyCons:= Recycle a lot of monster sprites= Recycle a lot of map textures/layouts= Might want to switch your steam friends list to "offline" ecks dee! Not everyone can handle the weeb cuteness.9.1/10The only game franchise that could possibly be better than this one would be if Dark Souls and HDN somehow had a baby in 4k graphics with virtual reality hardware. Hmmm=== Spoiler ===Noire is proof 2D > 3DKappa no Kappa :3Edit: I've now played through Re;Birth1, 2 and 3.As it is with most things that come in threes, the first is good, the second is okay, and the third is the best. However, this game sets the foundation for the characters and universe necessary to fully appreciate the other titles. P.S. This game took my Steam Review virginity. #Worth

content:
Posted: July 11, 2016
Product received for free
												Okay so, I LOVE the JRPG genre of games. The first I played ever was Kingdom Hearts, later on lead me to try Final Fantasy and much more. Neptunia Re;Birth1 is a remake of the original on PS3, you can also buy this game on PS Vita too. So what to expect from this game? LOTS! Firstly there is tons to do in this game in terms of quests, items, unlockables, and I have at this time of the review have only gotten near the ending of the first visit to Lowee. The game is full of laughs and for those who are dub watchers(don't worry, you can switch between sub and dub so EVERYONE BE HAPPY). Neptune the main character is well... a bit of a happy airhead who loves to break the 4th wall more than Deadpool ever did. To sum up the universe it takes place in(Gameindustri), its the personification of the game console wars we have irl(example PlayStation vs. Xbox vs. Nintendo vs. Sega). However its a typical turn based RPG with TONS of action and its quite fun. You will pick up on tons of references of other popular games like Zelda("Its dangerous to go alone, take Nep!") and even Final Fantasy(Pay attention to what she will say or sing when she levels up, you will get the reference). The game during the sale was about $3 and DLC's are reasonable, I believe on PlayStation Vita with PS Plus you can get it that price year round and also recieve the 2nd remake for the same price. All in all this is a great way to be introduced to the series and I DEFINATELY recommend. A solid 8/10 "One of the best Neppin JRPGS you will play!"

content:
Posted: August 27, 2016
												I have three chapters left in this game, but I think I've played enough to say, GET IT NOW, or at least as soon as possible.  If you don't mind grinding, this game has the perfect amount of everything that any anime has ever had.  The story is hilarious.  Most of the cutscenes are told in VN form, but the few CGs are pretty good.  Also, I will say that I HATE dlc.  If it doesn't add anything significant (like skins and such) I personally despise it especially if it cost more than .50, but this is one of the few games where I will say BUY ALL THE DLC.  The two character DLCs are AMAZING.  One of them is a kawaii girl and the other is a flat chested boxer.  Both are very powerful, but not too OP that you can use them the entire game without a challenge.  I highly recommend you buy this game.  It is amazingly fun.  The only problem I would say is that the Mouse and Keyboard controls suck.  Play with a contoller.

Posted: July 26, 2016
												Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth1, I love this game. I haven't played any of the previous installments of this series, but I personally do not feel like I'm missing out on anything.Pros:Witty and comical humor! (Nep-Nep makes this game great)Fun and intersting combatThe game delivers what a jrpg is - grinding levels (I enjoy constant battles to increase my characters levels and power)The story is actually fun to followSo many outfits to choose from!Cons:Because of the constant need to grind, the game doesn't feel as large as it should. Your time spent is in the same dungeons over and over.Lack of in-depth character customization (I didn't really expect this game to have it, but it would have been nice to have just a little more variety.The game is fun and if you enjoy jrpg this title is right up your alley. I own the other Neptunia games on Steam as well now because of this game and I expect the series only gets better.

												First off, I'd like to say that I watched the HDN anime first without even knowing what it was about. Eventually, I found out that its origins were from a game (a terrible one). I was a bit skeptical at first when I bought it, but it was 50% off so why not?Based on the many reviews I've read about the original game, I'm glad that I bought this one. The Remake System that is included in the HDN Re;Birth 1 has done wonders for the game and allowed for drastic improvements to be made overall.I don't want to get into any spoilers, but I will say that this is one of the best JRPG I've laid my hands on.  The artwork, plot, characters, music. EVERYTHING JUST FITS PERFECTLY. Maybe it's just me, but the BGM during boss fights and EXE drives gives me tingles every time I get into a battle.  The light-hearted personality of Neptune just makes everything 9999% better.  I've only just recently hit lvl 999 with Neptune alone and I'm planning on doing the rest.  This game is awesome. I haven't even slept yet and I don't even regret it.Nep-Nep 2 sugoi

content:
Posted: July 5, 2016
 what you would assume by seeing the shop site of Hyperdimension Neptunia Re:birth 1 is that its your generic Anime game with cute girls but is it really just that ? here is a list of pros and cons:+cute anime girls i guess ?+good voiceover  (when its there) +great animation+while playing the feeling of wanting to die becomes less-even with weaken enemies its still really hard sometimes-somehow the english voiceover is just half complete-minimized settingsif we add all that together Hyperdimension Neptunia is a solid JRPG with great characters who dont fear breaking the 4th wall.still there is some problems like that you dont have a option for choosing the diffeculti of the game  so it more or less forces you to grind till you gain the option of weakening the enemies wich at somepoint isnt really enough so you have to go back to grinding. BUT THE CUTE ANIMU GIRLS DESU DESU SUGOI yeah the animation of the characters especialy when they use theyre exe drive( a special attack that takes some time to charge) is really good but what me personaly really annoyed was that it somehow decides through a coin toss if you have a english voiceover or not.and last but not least the controller support..playing it with a controller is actually essential because you will end up clicking all across your keyboard to find the right button.last word...  finally if you enjoy grinding a lot and getting rewarded by just a smile from Nep-nep(neptune). buy itif you hate long boss fights and putting a lot of thinking in your attacks. dont buy itif you have lost all self respect by watching 90% of the anime that comes out every season. you should think about buying it and watch the anime firstoverall getting the game for 5€ was a good invest of my money  in my eyesi give it a 8.5/10 "oh boi i have lost all self respect and started playing animu geimus because of this"

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 18, 2016
												This game at first looks like another Japanese game with no substance or thought, but it is actually quite the experience. Yes, the dungeons are a bit samey and the combat starts off very slow, but past that is a great JRPG.An interesting setting of a multiverse where different game companys embodied as different nations are ruled over by these beautiful Goddesses. The characters are lovable and diverse, and all interaction between them (including fanservice) is always a treat. The story is somewhat basic but gradually steps up into an interesting adventure. The soundtrack is great, full of upbeat electronic battle themes and catchy field themes. The game comes in japanese or english. I preferred Jap (being weeb and all that) as it made the characters more expressive and moe. In English, instead the characters sound like typical anime dubbed characters, but with more catchy punchlines.The combat is unique as it is "3D Turn-Based" where characters may move around a specific area during their turns before they unleash a button mash of combos and other special JRPG combat shenanigans (transformations, finishers, etc). And the enemies certainly live up to the theme of a gaming world with many traditional RPG tropes like dragons to pop culture references (there's an enemy which is literally a screenshot of a dating sim xD). Character progression is pretty simple here with typical level ups and gear crafting. Theres also a friendship system between characters where they can perform special combos and assist eachother in battle, even if on of them aren't in the party group.Overall, a great JRPG which is one of many in it's series. I have yet to play them at this point in time, but before those, why not try out this gem of a videogame?

number of helpful: No ratings yet2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 2, 2016
												(One of the) Best gaming series ever made. R8 8/8 m8 time to masturb81+7 :)A friend gifted the latest title to me as a bit of a joke...*Plays game super attentively****3 hours later***Bought the rest of the games thanks to the massive black friday sales. I couldn't believe I hadn't discovered the gaming series before! I'm now addicted. Inner weeb levels are approaching over 9000!!!!=== No Spoiler Review ===But for real. Its like 1/3rd visual novel (with high quality voice acting) 1/3rd kawaii final fantasy (and nothing like FF10 part 2, that was trash) and 1/3rd fan service (depending on your.. preferences of course). I've been pleasantly surprised that the game itself is actually a challenge. You may have to grind at some points in order to beat bosses or change up your game style a bit to progress through back-to-back boss battles. Unlike most JRPGS, the grinding is actually fun and addicting in and of itself. The story and characters are all cute, funny, and well-developed (in more than 1 area... hehehe). Also, the music never gets old! Battle themes, dialogue music, the intro song... they're all very polished sounding. Legit production quality.Honestly the only let-down I've experienced so far is a recycling of monsters and level designs. It does take away from the immersion a bit when you find there are variations of essentially the same dungeon only pathed slightly differently and with recolored monsters. There really is a lot of recycling in those regards. I'm pretty forgiving about it, but it does annoy me. To make up for it, there are a crapton of character customizability options (cosplaying outfits, weapon plan creating, changing your combos, etc) that is really nice to see in a JRPG. I really enjoy the battle mechanics because, as the game difficulty gets harder throughout the game, you really have to plan your attacks to make them count. Its also nice that the battle system isn't a linear ATB, rather akin to games like the Star Oceans and Tales series you can move around freely within a battle scene to position yourself strategically. It is a turn-based battle system, but unlike the goofy stagger system Final Fantasy 13 TRIED to utillize but failed miserably at, HDN has a guard-break mechanic that doesn't require an hour of playing just to proc once like the game-which-must-not-be-named-but-i-already-named failure title used.Overall, its a really cute game with just as much substance as cuteness to supplement. I got the game on sale for $7 but even at its normal price of $30 I would buy it in an instant now that I've been introduced to the HDN brand and am in love with it.Pros:= Story= Characters= Music= Excellent Voice Acting (option for Japanese or English)= Battle System= Character Customizability= Challenging= Easily 40+ hour 1st time playthrough= Whether $7 or $30 it is worth every pennyCons:= Recycle a lot of monster sprites= Recycle a lot of map textures/layouts= Might want to switch your steam friends list to "offline" ecks dee! Not everyone can handle the weeb cuteness.9.1/10The only game franchise that could possibly be better than this one would be if Dark Souls and HDN somehow had a baby in 4k graphics with virtual reality hardware. Hmmm=== Spoiler ===Noire is proof 2D > 3DKappa no Kappa :3Edit: I've now played through Re;Birth1, 2 and 3.As it is with most things that come in threes, the first is good, the second is okay, and the third is the best. However, this game sets the foundation for the characters and universe necessary to fully appreciate the other titles. P.S. This game took my Steam Review virginity. #Worth

content:
Posted: October 3, 2016
												The Neptunia Series, this is the greatest place to start the Neps if you ask me.It's basically the remake of the very first game of the Neps, Hyperdimension Neptunia. But of course, more better and redefined to make it more enjoyable to the others.This game is basically any other JRPGs out there, a turn based RPG that's easy to understand and learn. Nothing major and hard. All good and fun. You have the cutesy characters, such as Neptune. The protagonist. You have the cliche antagonist, Arfoire. Etc.The game has cute characters, cute voices, cliche stuff, comedy, cliche stuff, more comedy, PUDDINGand Neps, never can't forget about the neps ya know.This game is enjoyable for everyone, even if you're not into anime. It's relaxing in my opinion, but of course. Preference matters. So if you don't like it, go pudding or go home.But otherwise, i recommend you this game. Very much, just as much as probably Neptune would recommend. Same goes for the other series, now. What are you waiting for? Go Nep, or go even more Nep!

content:
Posted: September 18, 2016
												If you have ever watched or read Hetalia, then this game is basically it. The only thing that is different is the fact that everyone who is in a way a main character (or if they are associated with the main character) is a cute girl posing as a console (or as they are called CPU's) or a video game franchise (there are a few posing as Video game developers) instead of sexy young men posing as countries (except Vert, she is legal as far I know), there are no WW2 geopolitics involved, instead of that, the whole shtick was replaced with a premises of four goddesses (and some random mortal human cannonfoder, they're pretty much useless if you bought the DLC which gives you a goddess healer which is OP in any way) fighting an evil cult  which is a metaphor for console creators, and video game developers fighting piracy. The main villain is named  Arforie	 which the way you say R4i which is a tool pirates use to play pirated DS and 3DS games	. It's pretty fun if you can overlook an occasional grind.

Product received for free
												It's nice RPG for beginners. You need not necessarily conscious leveling for each character. Therefore, story progress won't be disturbed and you must be able to devote yourself to enjoying stories. There are a variety of characters who represent game consoles and game manufacturers in this game. They all are kawaii and unique, so you would find your waifu. And black humor is sprinkled in places. If you have had experiences with a lot of games, it will make this game more enjoyable.However, I also feel unfulfilled a little bit. (1)  English lack part of voice, unlike Japanese. (2) Despite looping the game, you can't skip event scenes. Though you can fast forward, it would irritate you. (3) There is a tough task in achievements. This might be great concern for achievement collectors. If you'll play this game, you should keep in mind that.

												Worth playing.It's definitely the king of trope jrpgs, but it's really fun. Like most jrpgs, however, you need to do a lot of grinding. Spoiler alert: you'll want to be level 80 before you face off the final boss. There is new game+ and you get to keep all levels/items/etc that you've found/bought within the game, so there's plenty of replayability after you beat the game. Besides, there's a few characters you need to unlock through two separate playthroughs if you're going for all the achievements.Also, boobs. Very important.

content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
												as much as i want to love this game. im gonna hafta give it some bad scores. even so i still recommend it. first off the controls must be memorized to realy get a feel for the game because all explanation of controls are still listed in their original platforms gamepad. while the game does have a menu you can look too for keyboard layout.. unless you find the buttons to acess the right menus it does little good. so for those who want to know: while on map and in dungeon the "o" key opens the ingame inventory/system settings menu. the buttons used for different attacks in battle are "u" "i" "o" or "enter key" for the bottom attack option as default. and for using items in battle press "r" to acess secondary battle options and the "k" key to use items. for these annoying reasons only i give the controls a 4/10 score. ah the graphics: i loved the graphics in this game very nice. so far it has never frozen for me and remains clear even in the worse of situations. 10/10 for graphics!  gameplay and storyline: i realy like the storyline but find some lingo to be even beyond my knowledge so it makes me think they were trying to reach out to even the most esoteric references just to put a smile on your face. and for the gameplay it was going fine until the west wind valley(dungeon number 3 without dlc). when i reached west wind valley at lvl 8 or 9 the balance between you are your enemies stayed good but when you reach the end of the zone thinking ok im lvl 10 or so now lets try this boss fight. no.. its not just 1 boss fight. its 1 boss fight folowed by another boss fight. you will not win. I had to grind till i was lvl 17 to stand a decent chance. now dont get me wrong i dont mind grinding, but when you have to grind nearly 10 lvls just to be a match and hafta use ALOT OF ITEMS IN THE BATTLE, its kinds ridiculous. and to put this calculation into perspective for you(once you hit lvl 12 you have to kill everything in the valley 2wice to get to lvl 13 so you can imagine this was a long process. and im not even gonna mention the dragon in the valley other then dont try to fight it till you reach lvl 25 (min). so for a score 9/10 for storyline but 6/10 for gameplay <--mabey a little too generous. and lastly for those who wanna know. DLC does not make the fighting and gameplay broken. i kinda wished it did (or atleast made it easier for me) so for a overall score of 6.5/10 for the game. not a bad way to waste time if youve got the "memory" for it..   haha

content:
Posted: February 16, 2015
												If I were to look at this game purely from an objective stand point, I'd probably go as far to say that this is not a good game. In a lot of ways it's a fairly bad game. The areas are incredibly repetitive going from Forest area to Snow area to Factory area pretty much exclusively bar the last dungeon, and not only are these dungeons very repetitive, they are also incredibly short 90% of the time and very linear 100% of the time. They are not randomly generated meaning you get one short floor and this gets tiring very fast as this can be, at times, an absolute grind fest of a game, especially early on, not so much in the late game. The music is incredibly forgettable and doesn't stand out at all and the voice acting (in English) ranges from pretty decent (Sam Reigal and Cristina Vee) to pretty awful (Almost everyone else). The story is very generic with the entire story being 'Evil Witch wants world domination' and the characters are also fairly one note receiving only small amounts development throughout.That being said, when I look back at the time I had with this game, I had a good time. The game has it's charm, it's certainly not a bad looking game, the art style and direction is very nice with the characters design being good between all the different characters. The combat system implemented is very fun and active, going for a slight twist on Turn Based Combat, allowing characters to freely roam the arena and positions playing a role in combat. It reminded me of Ni No Kuni's combat, which I also enjoyed. There is a variety of different moves that are unlocked throughout the game that are all very well animated and are fun to watch (Even if that fun is diminished somewhat the 100th time you've used them) and there are a ton of characters to unlock on use which all play quite differently. The regular moves that you do in battle are also quite customisable, as you are allotted a certain amount of points to allocate to Guard Break, Power or Rush moves, and you can customise the moves to suite your play style. As well as combat customisability, there are also a variety of different costumes to change the appearance of all the characters if you're into that kind of thing (and if you're they type of guy to play this game, chances are you are) as well as accessories which change appearance as well. The game can also be quite funny at times, depending on your sense of humour.Would I recommend this game? That is entirely dependent on what kind of games you like. If you were put off by anything that I said in that first paragraph, this game probably isn't for you and if you're not really into self aware humour, then avoid it like the plague. While this game certainly isn't a masterpiece, I had my fun with it and I would recommend it any of the stuff in the second paragraph sounded appealing. I don't think I'd pay full price for it (I bought it at 50% off) but for the price I paid, I definitely think I got my money's worth.Final Playtime: 34 hours 54 minutes.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 2, 2015
												I will spare you from the storyline. If you have any interest in this game whatsoever, you either already have a general idea of what the game is about, or you can look it up in less than five seconds. So, a turn based JRPG which draws inspiration from many other video games all while maintaining a steady stream of jokes directed at other works of arts should be a fairly chaotic experience, right? Well, it is. And honestly, this game isn't for anyone. If you don't have any interest in either anime or manga, you might as well turn back now, as you would probably cringe at everything the characters say and do.That's not to say the game is bad though. While the story is slightly lackluster, it's mainly about the hilarious dialogue. If you don't like characters breaking the fourth wall, trolling around or poking fun at each other, the door is still there for you to leave through. For me, who is studying Japanese, this was both fun and educational at the same time.The combat is where the game shines though, and it reminded me strongly of games such as Dragon Quest. With three characters on the field at the same, with three more as support, one of the more intriguing parts is where you can decide your own battle strategy. Do you want to go full offense? Go with a group of melee fighters. Do you want to play cautiously? Go with long range fighters. And if you want more support, there is always the option for that too. Whatever your playstyle is, with near 20 different playable characters, there is always one that will fit you.And there will be at least one character you will like more than the others. Oh, and while I'm at it, play it in Japanese, some scenes aren't translated fully to English so you will be left with a couple of quiet scenes.In the end, the interactions are hilarious, the combat is addicting, and if you are a collector there are a lot of things for you to find and craft. Don't see this as a hardcore game, come here if you're looking for some relaxing light and easy fun. I can't wait for Re;Birth2!

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 15, 2015
												Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth1Before you read this review I have to warn you that I am slightly biased towards JRPG’s and Anime games. Though for this review I am gonna try my hardest to look at it from a neutral perspective while noting things that are bias. Also I have to note that I have not played any other game in the serie, and I do not plan on playing any of the older games. But I am quite excited to play Re;Birth 2&3(This is also my first ever review)If you do not feel like reading my whole review then here is a summary in Pros and ConsProsAddictingFunny Characters Good AnimationsGreat DLCA lot to do even after the storyConsShort StoryConfusing StatsA lot of textDull if you do not like weird humour Story6/10 (Written from how I saw the story)Intro:The story is set in a virtual world called Gamindustri, this dimension is ruled by 4 CPU’s that each rule over one of the big land masses. Neptune/Purple Heart of Plantune, Norie/Black Heart of Lastation, Vert/Green Heart of Leanbox, Blanc/White Heart of Lowee. These 4 rulers have been locked in an eternal war called the console war. During one of the battles, 3 of the CPU’s heard a voice that told them to gang up on Neptune and basically kicks her out of Celistan (A dimension only accessed by the CPU’s and other goddesses). This is what ended up happening and Neptune lost all her memories in the process. After falling from the skies Neptune was found by a girl called Compa that ended up taking care of here. Main Story: The main story of the game follows Neptune and Compa and later on many more friends in their quest to restore peace to Gamindustri as an evil Goddess named Arfoire. Arfoire plans to steal the goddesses powers and become a god over Gamindustri. Personal Thoughts:The reason I vote the story quite low is for one reason and one reason alone. I wish there was more. The concept really went home with me and I really wish the game was long and therefore the story being longer. I thought this game was just gonna be wall of wall of wall of text over and over again. So I used the speed up option a lot. Later on I realised that the story was quite interesting and I decided to take my time reading it all and I really enjoyed it.Overall I really like the story,  I am also a person who usually plays games because they are awesome and do not care that much about the story, but as I said this story felt great to me. Combat7/10The combat in this game is quite standard to JRPG’s. The onyl unique thing I would say this game as interms of combat is that after you do a normal attack you get the option to use a “Rush”,“Strong”, or Break ability. Depending on which you use you can difference effects and outcomes. If you have played other JRPG’s then you will be able to jump straight in and understand most of it quite fast. Most new JRPG players should be able to understand the system quite fast as well. The animations for the attacks are all really awesome and beautiful, and really add that extra bit of awesome feeling when you unload your strongest attacks. One big complaint I have (reason it is not a 10/10) is that you get really confused while reading the stats of your characters. There is nowhere (at least that I found) were it explains what every stat means. This can be really annoying while you are leveling as having more in certain stats for some bosses can help. DLC10/10When I first found out that the game had DLC I thought it would just be another DLC driven game. Oh boy was I wrong. First of all there are 5 DLC’s you would have to buy to have them all, the total cost of these 5 are less 6€. So the DLC’s are cheap, but what do they add you might ask? They only add bonus content that is no way needed for completing and getting both the endings of the games. The DLC’s add things like, more characters to play, new dungeons, more items that you get from those dungeons. And the DLC’s each raise the max level with 300 meaning if you have all 3 your max level will be 999 instead of 99 as in the original game. If you ask me THIS is how DLC should be made, being cheap and not affecting the experience of the story. To me this game is almost perfect with only a few elements like the stats and the story bringing the game down a bit, but you can not have everything now can you. I rate the game as a whole 9/10.To end this review I am gonna answer some questions. And of course all these answers will be based on my personal opinion Questions.Is the game worth getting? YES, this game is really worth getting. Is the game worth the price? To be fair, I think it should be a little bit cheaper then it is now. Maybe 20€ instead.Would I recommend this game to a JRPG/Non-JRPG player?JRPG: If you like JRPG’s you will most likely like this game, and if you like Anime as well (Like me) I can almost guarantee that you will LOVE this game. Non-JRPG: I would not recommend this game to someone that is trying to get into JRPG’s but if the person has a little experience with them I would send the game their way.

content:
Posted: July 5, 2015
												As a owner of the PS3 originals this remake is far, far, FAR better than the original PS3 game. The combat system actually makes sense with the improved combo system. Items can now be used as and when without resorting to some percential system as seen in the original. The dungeon environments are reasier to navigate as is going from one nation to the next, the original had a really awkward mini dungeon which had to be traversed to travel between nations. This was really tedious. The visuals look lush on the PC. Running at 1920x1080 makes everything just pop visually. The frame rate is outstanding. I have not run into one single bit of stutter, glitch or tearing with the visuals. Something that I would find repeatedly with the PS3 original. The story has also had a tighten in this remake. While it is still heavily cutscene driven, it is nowhere near as bad as the original. There were sections that would be bogged down with massive exposition dumps, now they are streamlined and while still lengthy offer more enjoyment.

content:
Posted: February 7, 2015
												This is coming from a guy who has only heard of these games in passing before now. I had no idea what to expect when I was thrown ino this world. Good thing I didn't get time to prepare! Right from the get-go, this little lady Neptune, I had seen around the internet captured my attension, and she didn't let go!From what I read online after Neptune herself commented, "They really changed the story with this remake!" They really did change the entirety of the thing and it's suggested even those who played the original get into this too.Let's talk about what this game is. Hyperdimension Neptunia is a traditional JRPG that parodies every bit of gaming you can imagine. From locations, like Halo Mountain and the Hyyrule Snowfield, to the discs upgrades which allow you to 'create' games like CoD and other such that give you awesome stats, to the fact they've stolen some Tales Of Series Hi-ougi (Mystic Arts). This game is a wash with references to Gaming, even Visual Novels like Stein's Gate get a nod. For those of you raised on gaming, this is a tribute!The Combat system is the games most polished and strongest point. It reminds me of a far better version of the old Quest 64 Battle system, On your turn you move within a certain circle on the battlefield to approach or get away from enemies and then unleash your combo attacks to ether build upyour EXE gadge for specials, break attacks which lowers the enemies guard bar for extra damage if it's depleted, and simple power attacks for damage. The characters have their own set of combos.Speaking of the characters, they're fantasic, you have the four Console Patron Units, and Company self inserts, alongside of oneliner joke characters like Maryo and David Snake.There are several weaknesses in this title however. First of all, level design, the 'dungeon' areas are lazilly constructed and most are carbon copies, like seriously they litterally just copied and pasted the exact same locations with different enemies. Sometimes its nice that you don't have the feeling of, OH♥♥♥♥♥♥BRAND NEW PLACE, but the level design is simply lazy. Of course all the enemies are recolors too, but this is a JRPG, par for the course.Another problem is localizaton. It's bad, the dub is obsence, we're talking 4kids tier, the translations are censored and oftentimes wrong. I hope Idea Factory International does a better job for next ime becuase the character voices aren't going to improve, they're all set! At least they give you Japanese Voices.One other thing of note is this game is extremely grindy. As people discoveraround the level 10 mark you're going to have to grind hard. Luckilly the guides on Steam are solid and will assist you in time saving, but there are people who can't stand the grind.All in all, especially with these weaknesses, if you can feel yourself enjoying the characters and the combat system alongsie of the strong story and the references that abound. I feel like you'll love this game and won't mind the repitiveness of the level desgin. Thus I reccommend it.

												as much as i want to love this game. im gonna hafta give it some bad scores. even so i still recommend it. first off the controls must be memorized to realy get a feel for the game because all explanation of controls are still listed in their original platforms gamepad. while the game does have a menu you can look too for keyboard layout.. unless you find the buttons to acess the right menus it does little good. so for those who want to know: while on map and in dungeon the "o" key opens the ingame inventory/system settings menu. the buttons used for different attacks in battle are "u" "i" "o" or "enter key" for the bottom attack option as default. and for using items in battle press "r" to acess secondary battle options and the "k" key to use items. for these annoying reasons only i give the controls a 4/10 score. ah the graphics: i loved the graphics in this game very nice. so far it has never frozen for me and remains clear even in the worse of situations. 10/10 for graphics!  gameplay and storyline: i realy like the storyline but find some lingo to be even beyond my knowledge so it makes me think they were trying to reach out to even the most esoteric references just to put a smile on your face. and for the gameplay it was going fine until the west wind valley(dungeon number 3 without dlc). when i reached west wind valley at lvl 8 or 9 the balance between you are your enemies stayed good but when you reach the end of the zone thinking ok im lvl 10 or so now lets try this boss fight. no.. its not just 1 boss fight. its 1 boss fight folowed by another boss fight. you will not win. I had to grind till i was lvl 17 to stand a decent chance. now dont get me wrong i dont mind grinding, but when you have to grind nearly 10 lvls just to be a match and hafta use ALOT OF ITEMS IN THE BATTLE, its kinds ridiculous. and to put this calculation into perspective for you(once you hit lvl 12 you have to kill everything in the valley 2wice to get to lvl 13 so you can imagine this was a long process. and im not even gonna mention the dragon in the valley other then dont try to fight it till you reach lvl 25 (min). so for a score 9/10 for storyline but 6/10 for gameplay <--mabey a little too generous. and lastly for those who wanna know. DLC does not make the fighting and gameplay broken. i kinda wished it did (or atleast made it easier for me) so for a overall score of 6.5/10 for the game. not a bad way to waste time if youve got the "memory" for it..   haha

												To start of, you Just gotta love Nep-Nep. This game is quite fun to play. It has a couple of different characters to play with with all kinds of different attacks and specialties. The game itself is quite the same imo, its just killing enemies and bosses. But theres a lot of content around that to upgrade your characters. Also the storyline is quite nice. It doesnt really make sense from time to time but i liked it. I didnt like the training that much cause some bosses were quite hard to beat so it was all about leveling at those moment. Its older version cause there are several newer ones but its still fun.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												This only gets a thumbs up because I'm still not sure where I stand on this rainbow-colored trainwreck.Graphically & visually, aside from some hiccups (character walking speeds not matching terrain movement, namely), it's rock solid. The character models are fairly good, though design-wise I'm not terribly thrilled. Most importantly, it runs at a bedrock-solid 60FPS with very few instances of slowdown. Good on you, Idea Factory!, for that.In terms of gameplay, things start to slip. The combat is simple enough, and the fights are usually over pretty quick unless you're fighting a boss. Unfortunately, that's either because your side smashes the enemies in a single round, or they pound you into dust. As well, while it works, there's nothing new or special about the battle system; you attack enemies, build up a gauge, and then unleash all holy hell upon them. Basic stuff for most every JRPG since Final Fantasy 7 made that the bog standard, really. There's status effects too, but those are pretty much pointless in the face of just smashing everything.The story is where things get... weird. Beyond even "WTF Japan". I have little patience for dumb-as-a-rock characters, so having a cast full of them is an "experience". But something about it just keeps me glued, like watching a ten-car pile-up on the highway as it happens. Maybe my interest is due to some sort of morbid facination, because it certainly isn't helped by the terrible puns and rerun-them-until-they're-flat recurring "jokes". I feel like a befuddled scientist examining a specimine and musing "Well that shouldn't happen". I know with absolute certainty that I'm not the person this was made for, yet here I am...Oh, and weirdly scynchronized boob-flopping abounds. In shots that are otherwise stills, as well as in combat. But they're so artificial that it's almost repulsive. Maybe that's part of it?There are extras, of course: a full NG+ mode which lets you carry over levels and whatnot; all sorts of modifiers to make combat easier/harder, add new items/enemies, and so on; and a host of side-quests to perform -- most of which are of the "get/kill 'x' amount of items/enemies" variety. Other than the modifiers, though, there's little reason to repeat the game, as with most RPGs the story is dead-set linear and there are no multiple endings. I don't even think there's optional end-game/post-end-game/NG+ dungeons either, which is sort of disappointing.Oh, and if you want the full game, you have to get the DLC. Of course. At least its better than the original version, where the DLC was the only way you could get the ability to find the "hidden" item in every map... (I actually had to research that!)Overall, I don't *hate* HdNRB, but it's the sort of thing I'll probably shut off, uninstall, and forget about once I'm done with it. Not horrible (unless we're talking about the difficulty balance), but not exactly a shining example of the genre either. I'm still trying to decide whether I need a shower or a psychiatrist after inexplicably playing for the last 5 hours straight. I guess there must be *something* good about it, or I wouldn't be here typing this up.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2015



YouTube™ Video: Steam Review E32 Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth 1 

			Views: 507		

			Check Out my Steam Reviews and More! First thing, the PC port is just OK, the controls are weird,you’ll definitely want a controller; an odd thing I ran into with controllers is you must have it...		

Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth 1-   A JRPG developed by Idea Factory Inc. and published by Compile Heart(jp) and Idea Factory International(nm) this extremely light hearted adventure takes place in Gamindustri a region divided into four separate lands, Planeptune, Leanbox, Lowee, and Lastation with the Console War raging on, as four goddess fight for each other’s shares and ultimate control. *PORT* First thing, the PC port is just OK, the controls are weird,you’ll definitely want a controller; an odd thing I ran into with controllers is you must have it turned on before starting the game, otherwise it won’t detect it, at least for me it happened. Other PC settings are decent and it runs smoothly and I haven’t experienced any crashes thus far. *PLOT*Now that that’s out of the way, the plot is silly, really silly, intentionally silly. This game parodies the gaming industry in all aspects, sometimes it’s funny, sometimes its lame, sometimes I shake my head. There is no world shattering doom in this game, if you’re looking for an epic plot you won’t find it here, however, I personally have enjoyed the story so far, the characters are all upbeat, positive and full of energy, sometimes annoyingly so but, on the whole an enjoyable cast here, all of them girls with decent voice work too, (sometimes they can be high pitched and annoying) and none of the melodrama hack that takes itself too serious that is common with a lot of JRPGs.*STYLE*The style and music also remind me of other video games, music is this sort of techno rock (aside from the intro J-pop song), makes me think of Mega Man X. Style wise you have a bright, colorful, well drawn anime with limited cut-scene animations. It switches between a graphic novel adventure, to Final Fantasy dungeon crawling and the world screen looking quite similar to Super Mario World. It’s really easy to peg this game as a ‘girly’ game ( or a game for perverts), with all the bright, pretty, colorful, bubbly looking environments and enemies(and the underage looking girls), it’s not inherently bad, just something that may make or break the game for you. *GAMEPLAY*Gameplay is pretty simple, you select levels or locations; locations give you options for shopping, quests, and a museum which lets you listen to music you collect and look at other collectables, (something I wish more games did) and other general things, you won’t be exploring a city landscape, only looking at a screen which kind of takes a bit of the fun out for me personally. The only thing you will explore are the dungeons you select which are small zones with some hidden items to find, and lots of monsters to fight, the game can be a bit grindy when trying to progress the story, this is alleviated by their crafting system, which instead of items lets you craft (plan as it’s called in-game) things related to the game such as entirely new dungeons, adding different items to existing dungeons, new enemies and bosses and so forth, it helps keep the dungeons from getting too repetitive. *COMBAT*Fighting in this game is turned-based. You can move a character within a limited space and execute a string of attacks leading up to a combo (once you’ve built up enough exe gauge) or use an item or an ability like healing, it’s pretty fun to maximize your combos and you can dish out a lot of attacks, all of which are super flashy and look and feel awesome. Some characters can transform into HDD forms which is basically the Power Rangers when they go into their super forms, your character looks different and kicks more♥♥♥♥♥ The combat is probably my favorite part of the game. *VERDICT*I was honestly surprised by this game, it’s real easy to look at the steam page and the community hub and judge this game to be another graphic novels with underage looking girls. It is that a little, but the entire premise, the characters themselves, the actual role-playing mechanics delighted me and I rather enjoyed myself playing this game.  It’s entirely silly, and doesn’t try to be anything super serious and it pokes fun at our gaming industry as a whole, again its hit and miss sometimes, still thoroughly enjoyable. If you don’t like anime, JRPGs, or a game that is an all girl cast or you need a story to be epic in its scope then steer clear. If you got an open mind then check this game out, you will find a relaxing, silly and fun role-playing game that doesn’t eat too much of your time, and for $29.99 USD it’s a good bargain.TL/DRHyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth 1 is a JRPG with an upbeat, silly, ridiculous cast of characters and plot with the entire premise of parodying the gaming industry and poking fun at all of it. Sometimes it’s funny, sometimes it’s not but, it’s a solid role-playing game with fun characters and mountains of silliness. If you can’t stand anime, anime characters or need a more involved plot then you will not likely enjoy your time, for the others, check this game out, you’ll be pleasantly surprised; don’t judge the game on its surface alone, what’s actually there is worth $29.99 USD. 

-Thumbs Up from Royial Video Reviews can be found at:  The-RoyialNetwork

Other PC settings are decent and it runs smoothly and I haven’t experienced any crashes thus far. *PLOT*Now that that’s out of the way, the plot is silly, really silly, intentionally silly. This game parodies the gaming industry in all aspects, sometimes it’s funny, sometimes its lame, sometimes I shake my head. There is no world shattering doom in this game, if you’re looking for an epic plot you won’t find it here, however, I personally have enjoyed the story so far, the characters are all upbeat, positive and full of energy, sometimes annoyingly so but, on the whole an enjoyable cast here, all of them girls with decent voice work too, (sometimes they can be high pitched and annoying) and none of the melodrama hack that takes itself too serious that is common with a lot of JRPGs.*STYLE*The style and music also remind me of other video games, music is this sort of techno rock (aside from the intro J-pop song), makes me think of Mega Man X. Style wise you have a bright, colorful, well drawn anime with limited cut-scene animations. It switches between a graphic novel adventure, to Final Fantasy dungeon crawling and the world screen looking quite similar to Super Mario World. It’s really easy to peg this game as a ‘girly’ game ( or a game for perverts), with all the bright, pretty, colorful, bubbly looking environments and enemies(and the underage looking girls), it’s not inherently bad, just something that may make or break the game for you. *GAMEPLAY*Gameplay is pretty simple, you select levels or locations; locations give you options for shopping, quests, and a museum which lets you listen to music you collect and look at other collectables, (something I wish more games did) and other general things, you won’t be exploring a city landscape, only looking at a screen which kind of takes a bit of the fun out for me personally. The only thing you will explore are the dungeons you select which are small zones with some hidden items to find, and lots of monsters to fight, the game can be a bit grindy when trying to progress the story, this is alleviated by their crafting system, which instead of items lets you craft (plan as it’s called in-game) things related to the game such as entirely new dungeons, adding different items to existing dungeons, new enemies and bosses and so forth, it helps keep the dungeons from getting too repetitive. *COMBAT*Fighting in this game is turned-based. You can move a character within a limited space and execute a string of attacks leading up to a combo (once you’ve built up enough exe gauge) or use an item or an ability like healing, it’s pretty fun to maximize your combos and you can dish out a lot of attacks, all of which are super flashy and look and feel awesome. Some characters can transform into HDD forms which is basically the Power Rangers when they go into their super forms, your character looks different and kicks more♥♥♥♥♥ The combat is probably my favorite part of the game. *VERDICT*I was honestly surprised by this game, it’s real easy to look at the steam page and the community hub and judge this game to be another graphic novels with underage looking girls. It is that a little, but the entire premise, the characters themselves, the actual role-playing mechanics delighted me and I rather enjoyed myself playing this game.  It’s entirely silly, and doesn’t try to be anything super serious and it pokes fun at our gaming industry as a whole, again its hit and miss sometimes, still thoroughly enjoyable. If you don’t like anime, JRPGs, or a game that is an all girl cast or you need a story to be epic in its scope then steer clear. If you got an open mind then check this game out, you will find a relaxing, silly and fun role-playing game that doesn’t eat too much of your time, and for $29.99 USD it’s a good bargain.TL/DRHyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth 1 is a JRPG with an upbeat, silly, ridiculous cast of characters and plot with the entire premise of parodying the gaming industry and poking fun at all of it. Sometimes it’s funny, sometimes it’s not but, it’s a solid role-playing game with fun characters and mountains of silliness. If you can’t stand anime, anime characters or need a more involved plot then you will not likely enjoy your time, for the others, check this game out, you’ll be pleasantly surprised; don’t judge the game on its surface alone, what’s actually there is worth $29.99 USD. 

-Thumbs Up from Royial Video Reviews can be found at:  The-RoyialNetwork

content:
Posted: February 3
												"101 hours in and he's not recommending it? What's this guy smoking?"I know, I know. But despite all the memes, I really don't think this game is worth thirty bucks - much less the extra fifteen they try to squeeze out of you via DLC.Story:The story is as bland, light-hearted, and generic as they come. It's your standard, run-of-the-mill "save the world" plot, but its unique writing is a large factor in this series's popularity. Unfortunately, it's also a double-edged sword. As you probably know already, this game breaks the fourth wall fairly often, with characters constantly coming up with excuses to make reference to the fact that they're in a game. This, however, gets old. Fast. Especially when you realize that half these references were never in the original Japanese to begin with.It also makes fun of several tropes often found in anime, but forgets that it's also shamelessly playing them straight. For example, Noire is occasionally ridiculed in-game as being a tsundere (or at least, what that word's definition has morphed into), but that doesn't change the fact that she is one. Same thing for Older Brother and Younger Brother - their existence serves to make fun of male characters who obsess over boobs, but they themselves are male characters that obsess over boobs (something we don't need, since we have the player for that). News flash: pointing out your own stupidity doesn't change the fact that you're stupid.Where the writing isn't annoying, it's lazy. Who are these six people and why do they know Neptune? Oh, they're from another dimension, so no biggie. This will never again be questioned or even mentioned. Uh-oh, we're in a pickle! It's okay, we just need a Shares ex machina. (The game itself makes fun of this, but still - it happens.)But Kazoo, you argue, all that is just the game being silly and light-hearted! Can't you just have some fun for once in your life? Well, let me ask you this: would you eat candy - the same candy - for every meal for an entire week? You'd get sick of it, right? The problem with this game's story is that it's too one-note; it refuses to take itself seriously. There aren't really any dramatic tonal shifts, so the stakes never seem to be very high. It's hard to take interest in a story that's the same all the way through.Assets:Many JRPGs reuse enemy sprites at some point because they just didn't have the time, money, or creativity to come up with more. Oftentimes, that's understandable - when it's a rare occurrence, at least. In Neptunia, recycling of sprites is the norm. There are dozens of Dogoo enemies with only three different sprites between them. You'll fight the same orange flower in dungeon after dungeon, with maybe a new coat of paint to tell the difference. Giant dragons? Well, every last one of them looks exactly the same - they aren't even recolored. Even the (non-main-character) bosses are reused! I posit that once you finish Chapter 2, you'll have seen almost every significant enemy sprite the game has to offer.And it's not just enemy sprites. It's dungeons, too. Now, reusing dungeon textures isn't as bad a problem as reusing enemy sprites, but reusing dungeon LAYOUTS is even worse. Every last cave dungeon in the game is exactly the same, with only a few minor differences. Every last forest dungeon in the game is exactly the same, with only a few minor differences - and so on and so forth. Out of the 36 dungeons in the game, there are only (off the top of my head) nine different ones. Coupled with the recycled enemy sprites, this is GRUELING. It eliminates the fun of exploring a new dungeon. How can I get excited about it when I already know what it will be before I even enter?Gameplay:But this is a JRPG. The most important part about it is the gameplay. And to the game's credit, it has solid battle mechanics that seem mundane at first, but quickly become complex and interesting once you get slaughtered in the Colosseum for the first time. It's easy to understand, but it has aspects to it that make the more hardcore JRPG players salivate. You don't have to be good at JRPGs to have fun playing this game.Unfortunately, you collide - hard - into a brick wall near the endgame. Maybe I just suck at it, but I am convinced that certain parts of the game's later content (lookin' at you, Zeca Ruins 2) are designed to be impossible (or at least prohibitively hard) unless you buy the DLC. Which I didn't do, 'cause paid DLC is an evil concept that never deserved to exist in the first place. So if I'm getting slaughtered effortlessly by trash mobs at level 99, why should I feel the need to get Nepgear to level 99 too? Why should I feel the need to NG+ again and get Rom and Ram? Granted, I'm only talking about non-story dungeons here, but still.Perhaps it'd be easier on me if I bought better weapons for my characters. But with said weapons ranging from one to five million credits each, I'd have a lot of grinding in my future. A ridiculous amount, really, even by JRPG standards. And since this is an enormous price increase from the next tier down, the message is abundantly clear: either you fork over more cash, or you waste days on end trying to save up for a better weapon that will only MARGINALLY increase your chances of surviving an ordinary battle.After 101 hours of Neptunia, I'm looking back and wishing I could have them back. I really wanted to like this game - the range of character customization options is insane, the character designs are cute and full of life, the battle system is fun - but the story and the world are unbelievably boring. The cherry on top? The translator is incompetent at best and infuriating at worst. Don't buy this game. Not for thirty bucks. If it goes on sale, maybe - but personally, I'd recommend you take your business elsewhere altogether.

content:
Posted: January 27, 2016
												I fully admit, when I first went into it, I thought I would absolutely hate Neptunia. On the surface, it's everything I hate in one neat little package. But oh boy, was I wrong.The story of the game is about the console war, which as the name alone might have given away, is essentially just one big spoof of the console war between different video game console owners on the internet. Each console is represented by their own goddess, which is just a cute girl version of said console. I think this alone speaks volumes for the very lighthearted and goofy tone and story the game has. The game is very self aware, and knows that it isn't a new Final Fantasy, and it never pretends to be anything else, and I appreciate this aspect quite a lot. Even if one is bothered by this, which I can fully understand why one would be, the developers were kind enough to make it possible to skip dialogue with but the push of a button. Nifty, right?One of the first things that really struck me about the game was the surprisingly colorful and pretty environments you move around in during the gameplay segments. Enemy designs are equally cheerful and colorful, all of this goes very well with the very happy and fun tone the game is constantly aiming for. Unfortunately, it reuses these assets pretty heavily, to the point where some areas can be the same map but in reverse, and a lot of enemies are simply recolors of earlier enemies.The flipside of the reused assets problem is that they use it to make sure there's a somewhat massive amount of things to actually do in the game, at least. You'll constantly be unlocking new sidequests, new plans that require you to gather new materials so you can unlock new items, areas or maybe even gameplay changes. There's even a coliseum asking you to fight various difficult battles in exchange for very good items.Speaking of battles, the battle system is actually what mainly made me enjoy the game as much as I did. The combat starts out as simple turn based fights with a lot of emphasis on positioning, similar to the Legend of Heroes games. As the game goes on, more and more features are added on to the combat giving it more and more depth. It never goes so far as to become complex or particularly deep though, it adds "just enough". Some examples are special attacks, transformations and a pair system. Just enough to keep the combat fresh and entertaining, as personally I'm a sucker for the very over the top and flashy special attack animations.To summarize things; Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth is a simple and fun game that never really aims or pretends to be much more than that. If you're looking for a just solid and lighthearted JRPG then this game might be one of your best bets on Steam. Don't judge a book by it's cover, as I initially did, because you just might end up missing out on a pretty good game due to it.

												So like now that I have over 24 hours in this game, let me talk about it. There aren't many RPG's that keep my attention at all.Infact it's extremely rare for me to spend even 5 hours playing one. This however I keep coming back to for more. Why? Lets gloss over the pros.Pros+ Cute girls+ Very fun combat system+ A lot of things to unlock+ Can customize characters with outfits and accessories+ Fun system mechanics like the plans and rebuild system.+ Can get pretty difficult. Is quite a challenge.+ Developers are awesome people. You have an issue? Guarentee it'll be fixed the next day if you report it.+ Awesome special moves. So many of them too.+ WaifusCons- Story isn't all that exciting.- Only three characters allowed at once in battle. This is just something I dislike.- Not the longest of games.- Grinding and grinding and grinding.All in all? I would recommend this game with confidence. Even if you aren't that great at RPGs.

content:
Posted: February 3, 2015
												I only game on the PC so this is the first time I'm introduced to the Neptunia franchise, but I love this game so much.In this game, the grind is real; and if you don't grind enough, bosses will just one hit KO your characters. Also if you are a forgetful person like me that doesn't save very often, prepare to get wrecked as there is no autosave so you will have to start from your last save. Of course, there are save points before major boss fights and that always helps, so if you do get the game, remember to save ever so often.About the DLC, the DLC characters are kinda overpowered, buy it only if you want to support the developer. The game is basically easy mode considering Plutia's and Peachy's EXE Drive (read: Super Attack if you don't own the game yet) will take a big chunk out of a boss mob's HP bar. The colosseum mode added by the DLC is quite fun but requires even more grind as the mobs introduced there are even harder to burst down.A major flaw I found with the game is how they sort the 'Plans' to re-make items, which is very apparent when you go to the accessory category. This won't bug you unless you are keen on customizing your character as inventory sorting is still bearable and doesn't make it a pain to find consumables you need.Story wise, the game is basically satire based on the 'Console War' debate. There's constant referencing to other games to the extent that characters are named after games or game developers. Is it a good story? I don't think so but it's pretty funny most of the time. The voice-acting is also great; I listen to the Japanese voices as the English one is missing a lot of lines even in the beginning moments. Port wise, initially I thought there was 1080P support but the developer then clarified that there is no 1080P support. The max. resolution is 1600x900 which is okay for me. I use borderless gaming to run the game and I don't notice any 'stretching' or other graphical glitches. But to those who can see the pixel difference, you would probably notice it as a lot of the game depends on static graphics. The game runs at 60fps locked so there's that.  1080P IS HERE!!!tl;drGame is basically about grinding. Grind for levels, grind for materials to craft items, grind to complete quests.Inventory system sucks without any sorting functions.Funny story, constant 4th wall breaking and out of control references.Full 1080P supportArt is beautifulI love this game nontheless.EDIT: Now that I have partially started New Game+ (Second Cycle), I'm a bit underwhelmed. One would think that they could probably ramp up the difficulty considering that you are way way way overleveled now (in my instance, my whole team was 109+) Considering NG+ is a must-do if you want to unlock all the plans (unless you prefer to save scum), a much more difficult second cycle would have been awesome. This doesn't make it a bad game per say, I'm 40 hours in and considering the price, I have definitely gotten full value out of this game. Highly recommended at the current sales price of -50%!

												Lets be honest, we all are going somewhere for buying this game, now, I'm not saying a bad place, but I'm not going to say any place.This is one of them games I bought on the PS3 because I thought, "lol my friends will  think this is funny." Then I started playing it. They thought that was funny. Then they saw the 38 hours put into it, and then they started to really worry about me. They said, "Zak you need to stop, we care about you, let the lolis go, let the big boobie animes go, come back to us, we miss you, we love you!". But I couldn't. It was to late for me. Another 23 hours in, doing everything I could, I finally beat it. I took the disk out of my ps3, slammed it back into its case, and then proceeded to pass the curse of this game off to my best friend. I was free, I ran back to my friends whom arms, pale and clammy, where still very much wide open, still so very worried for my sanity. I felt I was safe again.But I was wrong.HERE I AM AGAIN, WHY MUST YOU DO THIS TO ME? COMPILE HEART, DO YOU THINK THIS IS OKAY?? WHERE IS YOUR MERCY? I TRIED, I ♥♥♥♥ING TRIED TO GET OUT, BUT THEY KEEP PULLING ME BACK IN. THEY WON'T LET GO. THEY WON'T LET GOOOOO. I AM DEAD. GOODBYE AGAIN FRIENDS. I WAS NEVER MEANT TO LAST IN THIS WORLD.
